column4: mh /var/www/homeskoold/gelberg folder has no read or write permissions set, how do i set them...becuz of this i am not able to access it via the web
anyone?
the file permissions of my var/www/homeskoold/gelberg folder
are not set, so i cant access the files in that folder via my web url
im trying to set them to "read"
do a "ls -la" and paste one of the resulting lines
most likely the files are not owned by www-data or your isp is blocking port 80
my files are owned by root?
yep.. not what you want.. sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/*
whats the reason for this
www-data is the standard owner of apache's files in /var/www ..
you as "manipulator" of the files should be in the www-data group

protected files all have a specific owner.. your stuff is owned by you.. system files are owned by root.. web served files are owned by www-data.. after that you also deal with permissions on those files.. read only, read+write, read_write+execute for three levels.. owner, group and everyone.
chown=change owner
when i setup ftp accounts, do i just set folder ownership to the same as the ftp username
ftp setup is a little more tricky.. depend on if you want each user confined to their own /home folder or make it universal.. I'm not good at setting up ftp.
now that i set the ownership to www-data
yes and no.. yes because security for apache is handled by apache if the files are owned by the apache user group.. www-data..
no because if the files in /var/www are not owned by www-data then apache has no rights to present the files to "the world"..
when i did www-data:www-data         , is that like a username:password? or is that admin:group
that's a user:group
you could do that too.. as long as the second name is www-data
probably because that machine's user doesn't have a user on the ftp machine and/or that user isn't listed in the database of users for the FTP
any suggestion?
